response.job_title: Postdoctoral Researcher at University of Cologne
response.skills: English, Finite Element Analysis, Matlab, Microsoft Office, AutoCAD, Research, Microsoft Excel, Engineering, Simulations, LaTeX, Fortran, MATLAB

profile_positions.description:
Acceleration techniques for high-order discontinuous Galerkin (dG) methods with applications to compressible flow dynamics
1. Error estimation
2. Local anisotropic p-adaptation
3. Implicit time-integration schemes
4. Multigrid
profile_positions.title: Marie Curie Early Stage Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Collaboration within the European network SSeMID (http://ssemid-itn.eu/)
Turbulence modeling using high-order Discontinuous Galerkin methods.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Collaboration within the European network SSeMID (http://ssemid-itn.eu/).
Implementation of implicit time-integration techniques for high-order Discontinuous Galerkin Spectral Element Methods (DGSEM).
profile_positions.title: Visiting Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Research Assistant at the Research Group on Biomechanics through a scholarship of the Colombian Administrative Department of Science (Colciencias): "Jóvenes Investigadores".

1. Formulation and implementation of Bone remodeling and bone healing mechano-
bioregulatory models using the Finite Element Method. Implementations in Fortran for Abaqus and Elmer FEM.
2. Development of numerical simulations to describe stress distribution and changes in
bone density around different geometries of dental implants.
3. Development of numerical simulations to describe cell distributions, tissue densities and
growth factor concentrations during bone regeneration.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
04.2014 – 12.2014 Student Assistant at the International Office of the Faculty of Engineering
        Student guidance and advice in the preparation of an academic international mobility,
        including research projects and student exchange.
    
05.2014 – 10.2014 Student Assistant at the International Conference on Science and Technology of Drying 2014
        1. Edition of the proceedings of the International Conference.
        2. Logistical support to the development of the conference.

07.2014 – 09.2014 Teacher of the Courses: “Kids on Campus – Bionics and Innovation”
        Lecture children of poor socioeconomic conditions about engineering subjects (physics,
        thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, heat transfer, basic CFD software, bionics and
        biomechanics): Classes and Workshops

02.2011 – 02.2012 Student Assistant of Thermodynamics
        Preparation of the lecture slides, lecture notes and organization of exercise courses
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant

profile_positions.description:
1. Measurements at the engine test bench and optimization of exhaust emissions for a V6
Diesel Engine (New European Driving Cycle).
2. Development of computational tools for analyzing test bench results (MATLAB).
3. Representation and analysis of EGR (Exhaust Gas Recirculation) behavior curves.
4. Conditioning of engine characteristic maps to identify particulate mass within Diesel
Particulate Filters.
5. Preparation of presentations for clients.
6. Literature search in Robert Bosch data base and journals specialized on Internal
Combustion Engines.
profile_positions.title: Intern
